basics.name: Ben Glasner
basics.label: Economist
basics.summary: Ben Glasner is an economist at the Economic Innovation Group (EIG), working on labor markets, place-based policy, and how social-policy design shapes economic well-being and opportunity.

work.name: Economic Innovation Group (EIG)
work.summary: Economist at EIG. Research includes labor markets, place-based policy, and how social-policy design shapes economic well-being and opportunity.
highlights: Labor markets and wage policy (including wage-subsidy design)
Transfers, safety net programs, and poverty dynamics

work.name: Center on Poverty and Social Policy, Columbia University
work.summary: Conducted analyses of major social policies and reforms and their effects on poverty and other indicators of well-being, including intergenerational poverty and the Child Tax Credit.
highlights: Policy evaluation focused on poverty measurement and well-being
Work on intergenerational poverty and the Child Tax Credit

education.institution: University of Washington — Daniel J. Evans School of Public Policy and Governance
University of Washington — Daniel J. Evans School of Public Policy and Governance

awards.title: Pi Alpha Alpha Doctoral Manuscript Award
awards.awarder: Pi Alpha Alpha (Public Administration Honor Society)
awards.summary: Award recognizing an outstanding student paper based on relevance, methodology, originality, clarity, and academic quality.

awards.title: NASPAA Staats Emerging Scholar
awards.summary: Recognizes PhD candidates on the academic job market selected to present work to public service education leaders.

awards.title: Agnes Reynolds Jackson Prize
awards.summary: Prize awarded for the best senior seminar paper (as described on CV).

publications.name: The Great “Transfer”-mation: How American communities became reliant on income from government
publications.summary: Report documenting how U.S. communities have become increasingly reliant on government-transfer income.

publications.name: The Impact of Opportunity Zones on Housing Supply
publications.summary: Analysis/working paper on Opportunity Zones and housing supply.

publications.name: How to end low-wage work forever
publications.summary: Wage-subsidy proposal/analysis aimed at raising low-wage work without discouraging employment.

publications.name: How many manufacturing workers are there?
publications.summary: Measurement-focused analysis comparing employer- and worker-reported manufacturing employment.

publications.name: Food assistance can disrupt intergenerational poverty in the United States, promoting racial economic equity
publications.summary: Coauthored policy post on food assistance, intergenerational poverty, and racial economic equity.

publications.name: The Effectiveness of the Food Stamp Program at Reducing Differences in the Intergenerational Persistence of Poverty
publications.summary: Coauthored working paper on the Food Stamp Program and intergenerational persistence of poverty.
